result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Miguel A Guadalajara

records.addlTxt:
11:10 AM Cases 21CF218, 22CF294 & 20CM389// Defendant Miguel A Guadalajara in court, in custody.  Attorney Alyssa F. George-Stifler in court for Miguel A Guadalajara.  Attorney Margaret Anne Kunisch in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim Rights Compliant. Court reviews plea agreement, charges and penalties with Defendant. Defendant pleads NO CONTEST to Count 1 in 20CM389, and NO CONTEST to Count 1 in 21CF218. Counts 2 & 3 in 21CF218, and Counts 1,2 & 3 in 22CF294 are DISMISSED AND READ IN. Court reviews PQWOR with Defendant. Court accepts pleas of Defendant and finds the Defendant GUILTY. Attorney Kunisch reviews criminal history, facts of these cases and makes recommendation. Attorney George-Stifler makes statement and sentencing recommendation. Defendant declines to make statement to the Court. Court sentences Defendant to:

CASE 21CF218:
Count 1-Identity Theft for Financial Gain-Repeater (F)
Sentence W/Held 
Probation 24 Months
-
CONCURRENT
-

CASE 20CM389
Count 1-Misdemeanor Theft-Repeater (M)
Sentence W/Held
Probation 12 Months 

-AODA Assmt & Follow Through
-Absolute Sobriety
-Maintain Employment
-Mental Health Evaluation & Follow Through
-No Voting
-Costs
-Report to P & P by 4:00 PM on 10-12-22
RESTITUTION total-$164.68 to Farm & Fleet

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victims and their residences. Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone. Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does. The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

1:06 PM Defendant Miguel A Guadalajara appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jacob Van Kerkvoorde (eligible) in court for Miguel A Guadalajara.  Prosecuting attorney Yolanda J. Tienstra in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $500 Cash bond with conditions: Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victims and the address. Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone. The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
